N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 831.3 - Rights of parties

State Regulations
(a) Each party
shall have the right to be represented by counsel. (b) Upon request of any party, the Hearing

Officer may permit discovery which shall be limited to the production of
documents and other tangible things. (c) Any party may request that the Hearing

Officer recuse themself from the proceeding when the party believes that the

Hearing Officer has a conflict of interest which would render them unable to
provide a fair and impartial recommendation to the Commissioner. The Hearing

Officer's recusal determination shall be final. If a Hearing Officer recuses
themself, the Commissioner shall appoint a new Hearing Officer and promptly
reschedule the hearing. (d) Each
party shall have the right to present evidence and cross-examine
witnesses. Notes
